intro: Godetia quadrivulnera var. tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf godetia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the flowers range in color from white to pink, blooming in summer. It is an annual herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
